intro: Diospyros rigida, commonly known as the hardy persimmon, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by orange to red berries, which are edible when fully ripe. Diospyros rigida is adapted to well-drained soils and can tolerate drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
